did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Yudenich collection
did.abstract: Correspondence, memoranda, telegrams, reports, military documents, proclamations, maps, and printed matter, relating to the campaigns of the White Russian Severo-Zapadnaia Armiia and other aspects of the Russian Civil War, White Russian relations with the Allied Powers, and activities of White Russian representatives in Europe.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Yudenich collection, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

controlaccess.head: Access Points
controlaccess.corpname: Russia (Territory under White armies, 1918-1920). Severo-Zapadnaia armiia.

chronitem.event: Graduated, Aleksandrovskoe Voennoe Uchilishche, St. Petersburg
Took part in the Russo-Japanese War. Promoted to Major-General
Appointed Chief of Staff of the Kazan' Military District and promoted to Lieutenant-General
Appointed Chief-of-Staff of the Caucasus Military District
Appointed Commander of the Caucasus and promoted to General-of-Infantry for victories in the Erzerum and Trapezund campaigns
Removed from command by the Provisional Government
Escaped to Finland and later Estonia
Appointed Commander-in-Chief of the White forces in the North-Western Military Sector and subsequently Minister of War in the Government of the North-West by Admiral Kolchak
Interned with his army in Estonia after failure of Petersburg campaign

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection contains material related to Gen. Nikolai Yudenich's Army of the North-West, during the period of 1919-1920. It includes correspondence, reports, charts and maps dealing with military action on the Petrograd front, military action and conflicts in the Baltic area and Finland and relations between the Army of the North-West and its European allies, especially England and France. The collection was first arranged by Lieut.-Gen. Nikolai Golovin and described in two volumes entitled "Podrobnaia Opis' Del Arkhiva Severo-Zapadnago Fronta Grazhdanskoi Voiny v Rossii 1919 I 1920 Godov. S Kratkim Izlozheniem Soderzhaniia Vsekh Dokumentov Imeiushchikh Istoricheskoe Znachenie", which can be found in Box 25. The present register fully retains Gen. Golovin's arrangement, in which the material is divided into files and each page numbered consecutively.

did.unittitle: ARKHIV SEVERO-ZAPODNAGO FRONTA GRAZHDANSKOI VOINY V ROSSII 1919 I 1920 GODOV, 1919-1921.

scopecontent.p: Material related to Gen. Nikolai Yudenich's Army of the North-West dealing primarily with the military situation near Petrograd and in the Baltics as well as diplomatic relations with the Allies, including Great Britain, France, and the U.S., and negotiations with the Baltic states, especially Estonia. Includes correspondence, reports, military orders and maps, printed matter, and personal documents. The present register retains the original arrangement of Gen. Nikolai Golovin, in which the material is divided into files and each page numbered consecutively

did.unittitle: APPENDIX.

scopecontent.p: Original bound register of Gen. Nikolai Golovin entitled "Podrobnaia Opis' Del Arkhiva Severo-Zapadnago Fronta Grazhdanskoi Voiny v Rossii 1919 I 1920 Godov. S Kratkim Izlozheniem Soderzhaniia Vsekh Dokumentov Imeiushchikh Istoricheskoe Znachenie"

did.unittitle: ARKHIV SEVERO-ZAPODNAGO FRONTA GRAZHDANSKOI VOINY V ROSSII 1919 I 1920 GODOV

File 1, 1919 May-September. Miscellaneous material, including intelligence reports, telegrams, and maps related to the military situation on the Northern Front, generated by the SHtab Severo-Zapadnoi Armii, Otdel Vneshnikh Snoshenii (Col. Kruzenshtern), Razvedyvatel'noe Otdelenie and Morskaia Razvedka. Includes material re Petrograd and its environs and the Narva, Luga, Gatchina, Iamburg, and Kronstadt front
File 2, 1919 October-November. Same as above. Also includes excerpts from Soviet newspapers and reports re Scandinavia and the Baltic region
Original binding cover describing material included in file

File 3, 1919 November-1920 January. Same as above. Also includes copies of Soviet decrees, declarations and slogans; maps indicating troop deployment; reports re conditions in Petrograd and the relationship of Danish Syndicalists to the Soviet government
Original binding cover describing material included in file
File 4, 1919 May-June. Same as above. Also includes material re military situation, including deployment and condition of troops
Original binding cover describing material included in file
File 5, 1919 July-September. Same as above
Original binding cover describing material included in file
File 6, 1919 September 5-November 16. Same as above
Original binding cover describing material included in file
File 7, 1919 November-1920 January. Same as above. Also includes operational reports, mostly telegrams
Original binding cover describing material included in file
File 8, 1919 June-December. Same as above
Original binding cover describing material included in file
File 9, 1919 December-1920 February. Same as above
Original binding cover describing material included in file

File 10, 1919 September-1920 February. Correspondence of Col. Aleksandr Brant, Rossiiskii Voennyi Agent v Germanii and Rossiiskaia Voennaia Missiia. Includes material re transfer of recruits from Germany to the Armies of the North-West; Libavskii Dobrovol'cheskii Strelkovyi Otriad Kniazia Livena; relations with Allies and German authorities
Original binding cover describing material included in file

File 11, 1919 May-December. Includes material re Estonia, supply (including through direct order of Winston Churchill), the military situation, relations with Omsk, the Libavskii Dobrovol'cheskii Otriad Kniazia Livena, the situation in the Baltic, and the defense of Petrograd; intelligence reports; maps; and the correspondence of Maj.-Gen. Vasilii Bezkupskii, Gen. I. Laidoner, Lieut.-Gen. Petr Glazenap, Col. K. Kruzenshtern, Gen. Nikolai IUdenich, and Lieut.-Gen. A. Gerua
Original binding cover describing material included in file

File 12, 1919 November-1920 February. Includes intelligence reports re disarmament of the Army of the North-West and the requisition of Russian property by the Estonians, relations with the Estonian government and the French, English, and American Missions in Estonia and the Estonian peace agreement with the Soviet Union; and correspondence of Gen. Nikolai Iudenich, John Allyne Gade, T. Tenison, Birk, S. Sazonov, Gen. I. Laidoner, and Lieut.-Gen. P. Glazenap
Original binding cover describing material included in file

File 13. Includes intelligence reports re the situation of the Army of the North-West after the Soviet-Estonian Peace Treaty, the situation in Finland, the arrest of an anti-Bolshevik conspiracy in Petrograd, Estonian mistreatment of military and civilian refugees, the army of Maj.-Gen. S. Bulak-Balakhovich. Also includes a copy of the treaty between Estonia and the Soviet Union, and the correspondence of Lieut.-Gen. Evgenii Miller, Gen. Nikolai IUdenich, Lieut.-Gen. A. Gerua, Il'ia Bunakov-Fundaminski, Evgenii Sablin and A. Guchkov
Original binding cover describing material included in file

File 14. Telegraph transcripts and transcripts of telephone conversations. Also correspondence of Col. K. Kruzenshtern, Major-Gen. Aleksandr Rodzianko, Gen. Nikolai IUdenich, Lieut.-Gen. Petr Glazenap, Gen. Vladimirov
Original binding cover describing material included in file

File 15. Miscellaneous material related to Helsingfors, Finland, including personnel matters and the procurement of visas. Includes correspondence of Maj.-Gen. Kondyrev, Gen. Nikolai Iudenich, and Lieut.-Gen Petr Glazenap
Original binding cover describing material included in file

File 16. Correspondence between the Army of the North-West and the Estonian General Staff. Includes material re deployment of military forces, supply, conflicts between Russian and Estonian authorities (individual cases and theft of Russian military supplies), liquidation of military materiel. Includes correspondence of Col. K. Kruzenshtern; Gen. Nikolai IUdenich; Gen. I. Laidoner; Lieut.-Gen. Petr Glazenap

File 17. Same as above. Includes leaflets and proclamations of the Estonian government re demobilization of the Army of the North-West, the transfer of Russian troops to other anti-Bolshevik armies, conflicts with Estonians, and the work of the Liquidation Committee
File 18. Radio transcripts and reports re situation on various Civil War fronts, mostly of the French Ministère de la Guerre and Moscow Radio
Original binding cover describing material included in file

File 19. Office of the Voennyi Agent v Danii, Maj.-Gen. Sergei Pototskii. Reports, including intelligence reports re progress of the Civil War, Soviet activity in Europe and the organization of intelligence gathering and supply. Includes correspondence of Col. K. Kruzenshtern and Gen. Nikolai Iudenich
Original binding cover describing material included in file

File 20. Office of the Voennyi Agent v Danii, Maj.-Gen. Sergei Pototskii. Material re military personnel matters, supply, public relations with European powers, arrest of Gen. Nikolai IUdenich by Maj.-Gen. S. Bulak-Balakhovich, negotiations for right of passage for former officers of the Army of the North-West. Includes correspondence of Col. K. Kruzenshtern and Lieut.-Gen. Petr Glazenap
Original binding cover describing material included in file
File 21. Reports and correspondence of Maj.-Gen. O. Kruzenshtern re relations of the Army of the North-West and the Polish government
File 22. Financial matters, including correspondence with Estonian and British authorities

File 23. Office of the Rossiiskii Voennyi Agent v Pol'she and Voennaia Missiia v Pol'she ot Severo-Zapadnago Fronta Russkikh Armii. Miscellaneous material re the Pinsko-Volynskaia Brigada, administrative, personnel and financial matters, relations with the Polish government and army, Col. Bermondt-Avalov's Army, the situation in the Ukraine. Includes intelligence reports, clippings from Polish newspapers, and the correspondence of Gen. Nikolai Iudenich
Original binding cover describing material included in file
File 24. Miscellaneous material re recruitment of Russian officers in Poland

File 25. Office of the Commander-in-Chief, Gen. Nikolai IUdenich. Includes material re Col. Bermondt-Avalov, relations with the Polish government, and the procurement of military supplies. Also includes reports of the Commander-in-Chief, communications related to the approach to Petrograd, and correspondence with President Woodrow Wilson, Sen. William King, and John C. Groome (ARA)
Original binding cover describing material included in file

File 26. Office of the Commander-in-Chief, Gen. Nikolai IUdenich. Includes material re military situation, relations with the Estonian government, supplies and financial matters, especially related to the Bank of Estonia, negotiations re use of railroads, decorations awarded to personnel of the American Red Cross and the French and British Missions, relations with the British Military Mission and the British government, and the demobilization of the Army of the North-West. Also includes general office correspondence and correspondence with Gen. Laidoner, Maj.-Gen. Aleksandr Rodzianko, Col. K. Kruzenshtern, S. Lianozov, V. Troitskii-Seniutovich, Sir Winston Churchill
Original binding cover describing material included in file

File 27. Office of the Voennyi Predstavitel' Verkhovnago Pravitelia pri Soiuznykh Pravitel'stvakh i Soiuznom Verkhovnom Komandovanii, Gen. Dmitrii SHcherbachev. Includes material re relations with Estonian and Polish governments, procurement of military supplies, and plans for supplying Petrograd; official orders, protocols of meetings, and correspondence of S. Sazonov, and V. Troitskii-Seniutovich
Original binding cover describing material included in file

File 28. Office of the Allied Military Mission in Finland and the Baltic States (Gen. Sir Hubert Gough) and the British Military Mission in Reval and Riga. Includes material re relations between the Army of the North-West and the Estonian government, British policy toward Estonia and the Army of the North-West, relations between Col. Bermondt-Avalov and the Latvian government, general situation of Col. Bermondt-Avalov's army, military supply, confiscation of military supplies by Estonian authorities, American Relief Administration and the Liquidation Commission of the Army of the North-West, and individual requests for visas. Includes correspondence of Gen. Sir Hubert Gough, Brig.-Gen. F. Marsh, Brig.-Gen. Burt, Col. K. Kruzenshtern, Gen. I. Laidoner, and Gen. Petr Glazenap
Original binding cover describing material included in file
File 29. Miscellaneous material re transfer of military personnel bound for the Army of the North-West from Reval to Narva. Includes lists of passengers
File 30. Office of the Rossiiskii Poslannik v Stokgol'me, Konstantin Gul'kevich. Includes telegrams and other correspondence transferred to Gen. Nikolai IUdenich through Stockholm
Original binding cover describing material included in file
File 31. Material re mobilization of Russian military personnel residing in Latvia, Lithuania and Estonia
File 32. Material related to the American Red Cross
Original binding cover describing material included in file

File 33. Osobyi Komitet po Delam Russkikh v Finliandii. Miscellaneous material re mobilization of Russian military personnel, reports re supply of Petrograd, and intelligence reports. Includes correspondence of Gen. Nikolai IUdenich, Lieut.-Gen. Evgenii Miller, Lieut.-Gen. Gulevich

File 34. Army of the North (Arkhangel'sk). Intelligence reports and other material re use of railroads and the transport of troops. Includes correspondence of Lieut.-Gen. Evgenii Miller, Col. D. Kandaurov, Col. K. Kruzenshtern
File 35. Transcripts of telegrams related to the British Military Mission in Warsaw
File 36. Material related to the British Mission in Riga
File 37. Material related to the army of Col. Bermondt-Avalov. Includes orders of Gen. Nikolai Iudenich
File 38. Material related to the British Commission for the Baltic Provinces and the British Mission in Estonia
File 39. Reports re situation in Latvia; reports of the Commission Interalliée dans les Régions Baltiques; excerpts from the Latvian press
Original binding cover describing material included in file

File 40. Rossiiskaia Voennaia Missiia v Londone and Spetsial'naia Voennaia Missiia v Londone. Reports and correspondence, especially re political situation in Europe, aid of European powers to the White armies in the Baltic, military situation in the Baltic, personnel matters. Includes correspondence of Major-Gen. A. Gerua, K. Nabokov, and Gen. Nikolai IUdenich
Original binding cover describing material included in file
File 41. Same as above

File 42. Rossiiskii Voennyi Agent v Danii, Shvetsii I Norvegii. Reports, telegrams, and correspondence with other Russian representatives in Europe, mostly re relations with European powers, the military situation in the Baltic, delivery of supplies, personnel matters. Includes correspondence of Col. Dmitrii Kandaurov
Original binding cover describing material included in file
File 43. Mission Française en Estonie and Missions Militaires Françaises dans les Pays Baltes. Official correspondence
Original binding cover describing material included in file
File 44. Lieut.-Gen. P. Glazenap. Correspondence of Col. K. Kruzenshtern

File 45. Predstavitel' Glavnokomanduiushchago Severo-Zapadnoi Armii v Finliandii, Lieut.-Gen. Gulevich. Reports and correspondence re supplies, personnel matters, intelligence operations and the military situation, especially on the Ingemarland front near Petrograd
Original binding cover describing material included in file
File 46. Glavnyi Nachal'nik Snabzheniia Severo-Zapadnoi Armii. Reports and correspondence re supply. Includes lists of aid from Allies and supplies confiscated by the Estonian government
Original binding cover describing material included in file

File 47. Nachal'nik Snabzheniia Severo-Zapadnoi Armii, Nachal'nik Kontseliarii Voennago Ministra Severo-Zapadnoi Rossii, and Russkii Voennyi Predstavitel' v Estonii. Reports and correspondence re supply, military personnel matters, relations with Finland and the Baltic States, especially Estonia, the kidnapping of Gen. Nikolai IUdenich by Maj.-Gen. S. Bulak-Balakhovich, and the transfer of troops from Estonia to the southern front. Includes correspondence of Gen. Petr Krasnov
Original binding cover describing material included in file

File 48. United States Commission for the Baltic Provinces. Reports and correspondence re situation of Russian troops in the Baltics, supply of Col. Bermondt-Avalov's army, and re Petrograd campaign. Includes correspondence of Col. Gade and Col. Kruzenshtern
Original binding cover describing material included in file

File 49. Gouvernement Provisoire de Lettonie and Ministère des Affaires Étrangères. Mostly correspondence re the repatriation of Latvian soldiers serving in the Army of the Northwest. Includes correspondence of S. Lianozov
File 50. Rossiiskoe Voennoe Predstavitel'stvo v Finliandii. Material re appointment of Gen. Kondzerovskii
File 51. Reports re organization of the Petrograd Army, military orders, and miscellaneous material related to the American-Russian Committee for the Relief and Salvation of Russia
Original binding cover describing material included in file
File 52. Miscellaneous office correspondence
Original binding cover describing material included in file
File 53. Reports re military situation on the Northern Front and the political situation in Europe used for official communiques
Original binding cover describing material included in file
File 54. SHtab Glavnokomanduiushchago. Military orders, maps, intelligence reports and news summaries
Original binding cover describing material included in file
File 55. SHtab Glavnokomanduiushchago. Includes eyewitness report re conditions in the Soviet Union by Gen. A. Gerua
Original binding cover describing material included in file
File 56. SHtab Glavnokomanduiushchago. Same as above
Original binding cover describing material included in file
File 57. SHtab Glavnokomanduiushchago. Same as above
Original binding cover describing material included in file
File 58. SHtab Glavnokomanduiushchago. Includes material dealing with Petrograd, the condition of its defenses, transportation network, and public utilities
Original binding cover describing material included in file
File 59. SHtab Glavnokomanduiushchago. Includes material re recruitment of military personnel for the White Armies among Russian prisoners of war
Original binding cover describing material included in file
File 60. SHtab Glavnokomanduiushchago. Includes hand drawn maps depicting military situation in the Petrograd region, 1919. See also Box 24
File 61. SHtab Glavnokomanduiushchago
Original binding cover describing material included in file
File 62. SHtab Glavnokomanduiushchago. Includes miscellaneous correspondence, report re creation of an armored car unit, proclamations and other propaganda of the White Army
Original binding cover describing material included in file

File 63. SHtab Glavnokomanduiushchago. Primarily material re maintenance of the Army of the North-West, including negotiations with the British Ministry of War (including Winston Churchill) re military supply and financial aid, contacts with the British Military Mission in Finland and the Baltics, relations with Finns and Estonians, the creation of a naval force and armored car units, the recruitment of personnel, and establishment of new units. Includes correspondence of Gen. Nikolai IUdenich, Lieut.-Gen. A. Gerua, Lieut.-Gen. Nikolai Golovin, Gen. Kondzerovskii, Gen. Dmitrii SHcherbachev
Original binding cover describing material included in file
File 64. SHtab Glavnokomanduiushchago. Correspondence and reports re military situation on the Isthmus of Karelia and the Olenetsk Front
Original binding cover describing material included in file
File 65. SHtab Glavnokomanduiushchago. Miscellaneous material re the Baltic Fleet and river flotillas
File 66. SHtab Glavnokomanduiushchago. Material related to the administration of Eastern Finland
File 67. SHtab Glavnokomanduiushchago. Miscellaneous correspondence routed through Arkhangel'sk
File 68. SHtab Glavnokomanduiushchago. Miscellaneous material re Finland, including reports and excerpts from newspapers
Original binding cover describing material included in file
File 69. SHtab Glavnokomanduiushchago. Miscellaneous material related to the situation in Petrograd
File 70. SHtab Glavnokomanduiushchago. Reports, telegrams, and correspondence re military situation on various fronts
Original binding cover describing material included in file
File 71. SHtab Glavnokomanduiushchago. Intelligence reports, orders and correspondence
File 72. Shtab Glavnokomanduiushchago. Personal military documents issued by the Soviet authorities
Original binding cover describing material included in file
File 73. SHtab Glavnokomanduiushchago. Intelligence reports, orders, and correspondence
File 74. SHtab Glavnokomanduiushchago. Orders, telegrams and transcripts of telephone conversations
Original binding cover describing material included in file
File 75. SHtab Glavnokomanduiushchago. Intelligence reports and excerpts from newspapers
File 76. SHtab Glavnokomanduiushchago. Correspondence with Allied Missions in the Baltic region

File 77. Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Government of the North-West. Miscellaneous material, including reports, correspondence and leaflets, related to the Ingermanland Committee and the Ingermanland Regiment
Original binding cover describing material included in file
File 78. Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Government of the North-West. Same as above and reports re Kronstadt
Original binding cover describing material included in file
File 79. Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Government of the North-West. Same as above
Original binding cover describing material included in file
File 80. Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Government of the North-West. Correspondence with the American Military Mission and the ARA
File 81. Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Government of the North-West. Correspondence and reports related to the treaty between the Government of the North-West and Estonia
File 82. Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Government of the North-West. Correspondence with the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Estonia
Original binding cover describing material included in file
File 83. Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Government of the North-West. Correspondence and reports concerning arrests and detentions
File 84. Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Government of the North-West. Correspondence with representatives of the French government in the Baltic

File 85. Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Government of the North-West. Correspondence, reports, and printed matter re attacks by Estonians on Russian military personnel and civilians, and the illegal confiscations of Russian supplies. Includes correspondence of Lieut.-Col. K. Kruzenshtern and Gen. I. Laidoner
Original binding cover describing material included in file
File 86. Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Government of the North-West. Policy statements re relations between Estonia and the Army of the North-West
File 87. Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Government of the North-West. Material related to military service
File 88. Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Government of the North-West. Material related to the Army of the North-West, including relations with the Allies and supply
File 89. Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Government of the North-West. Correspondence re sale of flax by the Army of the North-West
File 90. Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Government of the North-West. Material related to the detachment of Prince Lieven
File 91. Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Government of the North-West. Correspondence with the Finnish General Staff
File 92. Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Government of the North-West. Correspondence with the Provisional Government of Latvia
File 93. Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Government of the North-West. Correspondence re the government of Pskov and the Ivanov affair

File 94. Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Government of the North-West. Lists of ministers of the Government of the North-West and officials of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs. Includes correspondence of S. Lianozov, Col. K. Kruzenshtern, Maj.-Gen. Aleksandr Rodzianko, Gen. Nikolai IUdenich, Gen. F. Marsh
Original binding cover describing material included in file
File 95. Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Government of the North-West. Miscellaneous material re Vremenyi Grazhdanskii Komitet gor. Petrograda. Includes correspondence of Senator S. Ivanov
File 96. Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Government of the North-West. Drafts of orders for a Special Corps of the North-West
File 97. Orders issued by the Special Corps of the North-West (subsequently the Army of the North-West)
Original binding cover describing material included in file
File 98B. Orders issued by the Army of the North-West
Original binding cover describing material included in file
File 99. Orders issued by the Army of the North-West
Original binding cover describing material included in file
File 100. Orders issued by the Commander-in-Chief and the Minister of War of the Army of the North-West
File 101. Personal Chancery of Gen. Nikolai IUdenich. Record book of incoming and outgoing documents
File 102. Personal Chancery of Gen. Nikolai IUdenich. Miscellaneous material re political situation in Europe. Includes correspondence with Russian Foreign Ministries
Original binding cover describing material included in file
File 103. Personal Chancery of Gen. Nikolai IUdenich. Correspondence with A. Guchkov
Original binding cover describing material included in file
File 104. Personal Chancery of Gen. Nikolai IUdenich. Correspondence with Konstantin Gul'kevich
Original binding cover describing material included in file
File 105. Personal Chancery of Gen. Nikolai IUdenich. Correspondence with Gens. Aleksinskii, Kondzerovskii, Rodzianko, and SHcherbachev, as well as Count Konstantin Palen and G. Aleksinskii

File 106. Personal Chancery of Gen. Nikolai IUdenich. Correspondence, reports, and minutes of meetings related to the Political Conference in Helsingfors, the Komitet po delam russkikh v Finliandii (A. Kartashev), external relations, domestic policy, and the financial situation of the Government of the North-West
Original binding cover describing material included in file
File 107. Personal Chancery of Gen. Nikolai IUdenich. Diary of events
File 108. Personal Chancery of Gen. Nikolai IUdenich. Correspondence with Count Aleksandr Buxhoeveden
File 109. Personal Chancery of Gen. Nikolai IUdenich. Correspondence of Col. Danilevskii, chief of the personal chancery of Gen. Nikolai IUdenich
File 110. Personal Chancery of Gen. Nikolai IUdenich. Intelligence reports
File 111. Personal Chancery of Gen. Nikolai IUdenich. Correspondence with and about Nikolai Ivanov and Maj.-Gen. S. Bulak-Balakhovich
File 112. Personal Chancery of Gen. Nikolai IUdenich. Diary of war operations
File 113. Helsingfors office of the Personal Chancery of Gen. Nikolai IUdenich. Includes orders of Lieut.-Gen. Gulevich and minutes of meetings of the Likvidatsionnaia Komissiia Sever-Zapadnoi Armii
Original binding cover describing material included in file
File 114. Helsingfors office of the Personal Chancery of Gen. Nikolai IUdenich. List of the staff attached to the Helsingfors office
File 115. Helsingfors office of the Personal Chancery of Gen. Nikolai IUdenich. Orders of the Commander-in-Chief
File 116. Office of the Governor-General of the North-Western Province. Orders of the Governor-General and the Commander-in-Chief
File 117. Office of Lieut.-Gen. Petr Glazenap. Includes reports and statistical charts re condition of the army and air force
Original binding cover describing material included in file
File 118. Miscellaneous unregistered papers. Includes correspondence of Gen. Nikolai IUdenich with A. Trepov, Dmitrii SHcherbachev, Sergei Sazonov, and G. Arsen'ev, mostly re foreign policy matters
Original binding cover describing material included in file
File 119. Office of V. Trotskii-Seniutovich, representative of Gen. Nikolai IUdenich abroad. Material re supply of the Army of the North-West, 1919
Original binding cover describing material included in file
File 120. Office of V. Trotskii-Seniutovich, representative of Gen. Nikolai IUdenich abroad. Material re supply of the Army of the North-West, 1920
File 121. Office of V. Trotskii-Seniutovich, representative of Gen. Nikolai IUdenich abroad. Same as above
Original binding cover describing material included in file
File 122. Office of V. Trotskii-Seniutovich, representative of Gen. Nikolai IUdenich abroad. Same as above
File 123. Office of V. Trotskii-Seniutovich, representative of Gen. Nikolai IUdenich abroad. Miscellaneous material re railroads
Original binding cover describing material included in file

File 124. Office of V. Trotskii-Seniutovich, representative of Gen. Nikolai IUdenich abroad. Reports and printed matter related to foreign policy and foreign public opinion, especially in England and France, 1919
Original binding cover describing material included in file
File 125. Office of V. Trotskii-Seniutovich, representative of Gen. Nikolai IUdenich abroad. Letter from Arthur Raffalovich and the Chambre de Commerce Russe de Paris, 1920

File 126. Office of V. Trotskii-Seniutovich, representative of Gen. Nikolai IUdenich abroad. Correspondence, reports, and packing lists related to aid from the French, English, and American Red Cross, 1920
Original binding cover describing material included in file
File 127. Office of V. Trotskii-Seniutovich, representative of Gen. Nikolai IUdenich abroad. Same as above. Includes correspondence of Boris Bakhmetev and N. L'vov, 1920

File 128. Office of V. Trotskii-Seniutovich, representative of Gen. Nikolai IUdenich abroad. Material related to military matters. Includes correspondence with S. Sazonov, Lieut.-Gen. A. Gerua, Vasilii Maklakov, G. Lianozov, 1920
File 129. Office of V. Trotskii-Seniutovich, representative of Gen. Nikolai IUdenich abroad, 1919. Material related to travel by military personnel
Original binding cover describing material included in file
File 130. Office of V. Trotskii-Seniutovich, representative of Gen. Nikolai IUdenich abroad. Same as above, 1920
File 131. Office of V. Trotskii-Seniutovich, representative of Gen. Nikolai IUdenich abroad. Material related to radio communication, 1920
File 132. Office of V. Trotskii-Seniutovich, representative of Gen. Nikolai IUdenich abroad. Correspondence related to transport of troops, 1920
Original binding cover describing material included in file
File 133. Intelligence reports and confidential correspondence re military situation, conditions in Petrograd, relations with Estonia, and political situation in France and England, 1919-1920
Original binding cover describing material included in file
File 134. Office of V. Trotskii-Seniutovich, representative of Gen. Nikolai IUdenich abroad. Minutes of meetings of the advisory council to V. Trotskii-Seniutovich
Original binding cover describing material included in file
File 135. Office of V. Trotskii-Seniutovich, representative of Gen. Nikolai IUdenich abroad. Material related to the acquisition of food supplies in Sweden, 1919
File 136. Office of V. Trotskii-Seniutovich, representative of Gen. Nikolai IUdenich abroad. Telegrams, 1919

File 137. Office of V. Trotskii-Seniutovich, representative of Gen. Nikolai IUdenich abroad. Correspondence, reports, and orders related to the military, especially the recruitment and transport of Russian officers stranded in Europe and the award of citations and promotions for bravery in France
Original binding cover describing material included in file

File 138. Office of V. Trotskii-Seniutovich, representative of Gen. Nikolai IUdenich abroad. Press clippings, typed excerpts, correspondence, and news dispatches related the Russian situation presented in the foreign press. Includes draft of an article by Gen. A. Gerua, "Chto sdelali my I soiuzniki dlia pobedy," and dispatches by Agence Hébertot, 1919
Original binding cover describing material included in file

File 139. Office of V. Trotskii-Seniutovich, representative of Gen. Nikolai IUdenich abroad. Correspondence, reports, and policy statements related to negotiations between the Government of the North-West, Estonia, and the Allies, 1919
File 140. Office of V. Trotskii-Seniutovich, representative of Gen. Nikolai IUdenich abroad. Correspondence, reports, and protocols of meetings sent to Lieut.-Gen. Nikolai Iudenich
Original binding cover describing material included in file
File 141. Office of V. Trotskii-Seniutovich, representative of Gen. Nikolai IUdenich abroad. Copies of documents brought by Gen. Gal'fter
Original binding cover describing material included in file
File 142. Office of V. Trotskii-Seniutovich, representative of Gen. Nikolai IUdenich abroad. Intelligence reports of the Military Representative in Denmark
File 143. Office of V. Trotskii-Seniutovich, representative of Gen. Nikolai IUdenich abroad. Report re political situation in Denmark

File 144. Office of V. Trotskii-Seniutovich, representative of Gen. Nikolai IUdenich abroad. Material related to negotiations for credit from the United States for the purchase of surplus military supplies. Includes correspondence of Major Ray Powers
File 145. Office of V. Trotskii-Seniutovich, representative of Gen. Nikolai IUdenich abroad. Material related to the purchase of supplies from Emile Richard of Marseille, France

File 146. Office of V. Trotskii-Seniutovich, representative of Gen. Nikolai IUdenich abroad. Material related to the relay of telegrams to Gen. Iudenich through French channels and the use of French couriers by the Russian government
File 147. Office of V. Trotskii-Seniutovich, representative of Gen. Nikolai IUdenich abroad. Material re shipping
File 148. Office of V. Trotskii-Seniutovich, representative of Gen. Nikolai IUdenich abroad. Correspondence related to the appointment of V. Trotskii-Seniutovich to his post
File 149. Office of V. Trotskii-Seniutovich, representative of Gen. Nikolai IUdenich abroad. Material related to the steamship Olga
Original binding cover describing material included in file
File 150. Office of V. Trotskii-Seniutovich, representative of Gen. Nikolai IUdenich abroad. Same as above
File 60. Oversize maps of the Petrograd front, 1919
APPENDIX

scopecontent.p: Original typescript, bound register made by Gen. Nikolai Golovin entitled "Podrobnaia Opis' Del Arkhiva Severo-Zapadnago Fronta Grazhdanskoi Voiny v Rossii 1919 I 1920 Godov. S Kratkim Izlozheniem Soderzhaniia Vsekh Dokumentov Imeiushchikh Istoricheskoe Znachenie"
